title.narrative: Global Peace Operations Initiative: Security Force Professionalization (SFP) Egypt Civilian Harm Mitigation

description.narrative: The GPOI program enhances international capacity to effectively conduct United Nations and regional peace operations. International peace operations are strategically important to U.S. national security and foreign policy objectives. The GPOI program is the primary mechanism through which the United States contributes to strengthening global capacity to conduct peace operations. The program's partnerships emphasize institutional capacity-building relationships and seek to strengthen partner countries' capabilities to self-sufficiently train, deploy, employ, and sustain peacekeeping forces.

description.narrative: The Tikkayat al-Gulshani was the first takiya, or residential religious complex, built in Cairo after the Ottoman conquest of 1517. title.narrative: Conservation of the Early 16th-Century Tikkayat al-Gulshani Complex in Historic Cairo, Phase 2

description.narrative: The Tikkayat al-Gulshani was the first "takiya " or residential religious complex, built in Cairo after the Ottoman conquest of 1517. This project, which continues work begun under a previous AFCP grant, includes the conservation of the mausoleum and physical interventions in other areas of the site.

title.narrative: Strengthening Governmental Efforts to Combat Human Trafficking through Increased Prosecution and Enhanced Victim Protection in Egypt (SETIP)

description.narrative: The overall goal of this project is to reinforce Egyptian governmental efforts to combat trafficking in persons by scaling up the prosecution of trafficking cases and strengthening the protection of victims in Egypt. For this purpose, the International Organization for Migration (IOM) will provide comprehensive capacity building to uphold rights-based procedures for the identificaiton and protection of trafficking victims while responding to the most urgent needs of victims. In parallel, IOM will strengthen the investigation, prosecution and trial of trafficking cases by capacitating relevant authorities in trafficking investigation and prosecution, ultimately with an aim to increase convictions of trafficking offenders in accordance with Egypt's counter-trafficking Law 64/2010.

title.narrative: Supporting the Government of Egypt's Efforts to Combat Human Trafficking by Protecting Victims of Trafficking and Enhancing Key Investigation and Pros

description.narrative: In line with the 2010 TIP Reports recommendations and building upon IOMs recent and ongoing activities in Egypt, including those carried out under the G/TIP-funded project, Supporting the Egyptian Governments effort to combat human trafficking by enhancing key investigation and prosecution capacities, this project will aim to continue supporting the GoEs efforts to address human trafficking, by strengthening capacities to prosecute trafficking-related cases and protect VoTs. Specific objectives include: (1) to strengthen national capacities to investigate and prosecute trafficking cases and protect VoTs and witnesses, through training courses targeting the police and prosecution, as well as other relevant officials; (2) to prompt more successful investigations and prosecutions, though joint seminars to improve the coordination between CJAs; and (3) to strengthen links between law enforcement and victim assistance agencies to improve victim protection and promote better access to legal advice and counseling.

title.narrative: Preservation of 3rd-Century BC Objects from the Greco-Roman City of Karanis

description.narrative: To support the preservation of 3rd-century BC objects from the Greco-Roman city of Karanis (present-day Kom Aushim) and establish and promote good conservation practices and public presentation of archaeological sites. The Pharonic-era objects from Karanis are stored under poor conditions, while political and economic circumstances in Egypt hamper the abilities of local conservators to care for them. The project involves a collections assessment, preventive conservation of the objects, and the development of a management plan for the site.

title.narrative: Conservation of 12th-13th-Century Shajar al-Durr Monument Zone in Historic Cairo

description.narrative: The Fatimid and early Abbasid period mausoleums of Shajar al-Durr, al-Sayyida Ruqayya, and al-Jafari and Atika in Cairo are under threat from rising damp and salt efflorescence which have compromised their structural integrity and surfaces. This project includes masonry conservation and site drainage measures.

title.narrative: Global Peace Operations Initiative: Security Force Professionalization (SFP) Egypt Civilian Harm Mitigation

description.narrative: The GPOI program enhances international capacity to effectively conduct United Nations and regional peace operations. International peace operations are strategically important to U.S. national security and foreign policy objectives. The GPOI program is the primary mechanism through which the United States contributes to strengthening global capacity to conduct peace operations. The program's partnerships emphasize institutional capacity-building relationships and seek to strengthen partner countries' capabilities to self-sufficiently train, deploy, employ, and sustain peacekeeping forces.
